required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anticoagulants Comparative Benefit-risk Ratio in Real Life
clinical_study.official_title: Engel 2: REal-life aNticoaGulants Comparative bEnefit-risk in Nonvalvular Atrial fibrilLation (NVAF) in France

brief_summary.textblock:
The study is an analysis using the French national health insurance database, six months after the beginning of NOAC launch in the NVAF indication.
The aim is to compare the one-year, two-year and three-year benefit-risk (major bleeding, arterial thrombotic events, myocardial infarction (MI), death) between patients starting a NOAC and patients starting a VKA for NVAF in 2013

primary_outcome.description: First hospitalization with primary diagnosis (Tenth Revision codes of the International Classification of Diseases (ICD-10 codes)) of: Hemorrhagic stroke, Other critical organ or site bleeding, Other bleeding (gastro-intestinal bleeding, urogenital bleeding and other bleeding subtype).

First hospitalization with primary diagnosis (ICD-10 codes) of: Hemorrhagic stroke, Other critical organ or site bleeding, Other bleeding with transfusion, or acute post-hemorrhagic anemia or death during hospital stay.
First hospitalization with primary diagnosis (ICD-10 codes) of: Ischemic or undefined stroke, Systemic arterial embolism.

First hospitalization with primary diagnosis (ICD-10 codes) of: Myocardial infarction (ST-segment elevation Myocardial infarction (STEMI) and non-ST-segment elevation Myocardial infarction(NSTEMI)), Unstable angina.
All-cause death (cause of death not available in the database).

primary_outcome.measure: Composite Criterion (Clinically Relevant Bleeding, Arterial Thrombotic Events, Acute Coronary Syndrome, Death)
primary_outcome.description: First event among clinically relevant bleeding, arterial thrombotic event, acute coronary syndrome, or death defined above.

study_pop.textblock: New users of NOAC or VKA for NVAF

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
Patients with NVAF with a first reimbursed dispensation of Pradaxa®, Xarelto®, or VKA in 2013, with no other identified indication for anticoagulation; Without any VKA or NOAC (Pradaxa®, Xarelto®, or Eliquis®) reimbursed dispensation for the last 3 years before the first reimbursed dispensation of Pradaxa®, Xarelto®, or VKA
Exclusion criteria:
None

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study ENGEL 2 is a real-world historical cohort study in the French nationwide healthcare claims and hospitalization database (SNIIRAM) including new users of DOAC or VKA for nonvalvular atrial fibrillation (NVAF) in 2013 with a follow-up for one year (main objective).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The main objective was to compare the risk & effectiveness for dabigatran vs VKA, & for rivaroxaban vs VKA. The main analysis was done for hdPS matched patients (pts.) with atrial fibrillation (AF) diagnosis information in the database.

group.title: Dabigatran
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of dabigatran in 2013 for NVAF.

group.title: Rivaroxaban
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of rivaroxaban in 2013 for NVAF.

group.title: Vitamin K Antagonists
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of VKA in 2013 for NVAF.

baseline.population: The main analysis was on matched patients 1:1 on the date of the first drug (DOAC or VKA) dispensing (± 2 weeks), gender, age at index date (± 1 year) and hdPS (± 0.05).Baseline measures were presented for overall treatment groups and matched populations: dabigatran vs VKA and rivaroxaban vs VKA.

group.title: Dabigatran
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of dabigatran in 2013 for NVAF, matched 1:1 on the date of the first dispensing, gender, age at index date, and hdPS.

group.title: Rivaroxaban
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of rivaroxaban in 2013 for NVAF, matched 1:1 on the date of the first dispensing, gender, age at index date, and hdPS.

group.title: Vitamin K Antagonists
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of VKA in 2013 for NVAF, matched 1:1 on the date of the first dispensing, gender, age at index date, and hdPS.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
measure.population: The main analysis was on matched patients 1:1 on the date of the first drug (DOAC or VKA) dispensing (± 2 weeks), gender, age at index date (± 1 year) and hdPS (± 0.05).Baseline measures were presented for overall treatment groups and matched populations: dabigatran vs VKA and rivaroxaban vs VKA.

measure.title: Sex/Gender, Customized
measure.population: The main analysis was on matched patients 1:1 on the date of the first drug (DOAC or VKA) dispensing (± 2 weeks), gender, age at index date (± 1 year) and hdPS (± 0.05).Baseline measures were presented for overall treatment groups and matched populations: dabigatran vs VKA and rivaroxaban vs VKA.

outcome.title: Clinically Relevant Bleeding
outcome.description: First hospitalization with primary diagnosis (Tenth Revision codes of the International Classification of Diseases (ICD-10 codes)) of: Hemorrhagic stroke, Other critical organ or site bleeding, Other bleeding (gastro-intestinal bleeding, urogenital bleeding and other bleeding subtype).
outcome.population: Patients (pts) with a first dispensing (dispen.) of DOAC or VKA in 2013 for NVAF. For each comparison (dabigatran versus VKA and rivaroxaban versus VKA), patients were matched 1:1 on the date of the first drug (DOAC or VKA) dispensing (± 2 weeks (wks.)), gender, age at index date (± 1 year (yr)) and high-dimensional propensity score (hdPS, ± 0.05).

group.title: Dabigatran (Dabigatran vs VKA)
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of dabigatran in 2013 for NVAF, matched 1:1 on the date of the first dispensing, gender, age at index date, and hdPS.

group.title: VKA (Dabigatran vs VKA)
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of VKA in 2013 for NVAF, matched 1:1 on the date of the first dispensing, gender, age at index date, and hdPS.

group.title: Rivaroxaban (Rivaroxaban vs VKA)
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of rivaroxaban in 2013 for NVAF, matched 1:1 on the date of the first dispensing, gender, age at index date, and hdPS.

group.title: VKA (Rivaroxaban vs VKA)
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of VKA in 2013 for NVAF, matched 1:1 on the date of the first dispensing, gender, age at index date, and hdPS.

measure.title: Clinically Relevant Bleeding
measure.description: First hospitalization with primary diagnosis (Tenth Revision codes of the International Classification of Diseases (ICD-10 codes)) of: Hemorrhagic stroke, Other critical organ or site bleeding, Other bleeding (gastro-intestinal bleeding, urogenital bleeding and other bleeding subtype).
measure.population: Patients (pts) with a first dispensing (dispen.) of DOAC or VKA in 2013 for NVAF. For each comparison (dabigatran versus VKA and rivaroxaban versus VKA), patients were matched 1:1 on the date of the first drug (DOAC or VKA) dispensing (± 2 weeks (wks.)), gender, age at index date (± 1 year (yr)) and high-dimensional propensity score (hdPS, ± 0.05).

analysis.groups_desc: Outcome was analyzed during dabigatran or VKA exposure period (on treatment) using: 1) Cumulative function to estimate the incidence (with death as a competing risk), 2) Fine and Gray model to compare the 1-year risk for dabigatran versus VKA, with hazard ratio (HR) and 95% Confidence Interval (CI ) (and death as a competing risk).

Outcome was analyzed during rivaroxaban or VKA exposure period (on treatment) using: 1) Cumulative function to estimate the incidence (with death as a competing risk), 2) Fine and Gray model to compare the 1-year risk for rivaroxaban versus VKA, with HR and 95%CI (and death as a competing risk).

outcome.title: Major Bleeding
outcome.description: First hospitalization with primary diagnosis (ICD-10 codes) of: Hemorrhagic stroke, Other critical organ or site bleeding, Other bleeding with transfusion, or acute post-hemorrhagic anemia or death during hospital stay.
outcome.population: Patients with a first dispensing of DOAC or VKA in 2013 for NVAF. For each comparison (dabigatran versus VKA and rivaroxaban versus VKA), patients were matched 1:1 on the date of the first drug (DOAC or VKA) dispensing (± 2 weeks), gender, age at index date (± 1 year) and high-dimensional propensity score (hdPS, ± 0.05).

For each comparison (dabigatran versus VKA and rivaroxaban versus VKA), patients were matched 1:1 on the date of the first drug (DOAC or VKA) dispensing (± 2 weeks), gender, age at index date (± 1 year) and high-dimensional propensity score (hdPS, ± 0.05).

analysis.groups_desc: Outcome was analyzed during dabigatran or VKA exposure period (on treatment) using: 1) Kaplan-Meier to estimate the cumulative incidence, 2) Cox proportional hazard risk model to compare the 1-year risk for dabigatran versus VKA, with HR and 95%CI.

Outcome was analyzed during rivaroxaban or VKA exposure period (on treatment) using: 1) Kaplan-Meier to estimate the cumulative incidence, 2) Cox proportional hazard risk model to compare the 1-year risk for rivaroxaban versus VKA, with HR and 95%CI.

outcome.description: First event among clinically relevant bleeding, arterial thrombotic event, acute coronary syndrome, or death defined above.
outcome.population: Patients with a first dispensing of DOAC or VKA in 2013 for NVAF. For each comparison (dabigatran versus VKA and rivaroxaban versus VKA), patients were matched 1:1 on the date of the first drug (DOAC or VKA) dispensing (± 2 weeks), gender, age at index date (± 1 year) and high-dimensional propensity score (hdPS, ± 0.05).

reported_events.desc: Claims and hospitalization database without any adverse event declaration, and using secondary individual anonymous information. Thus all outcomes studied were reported in aggregate in the final study report.

group.title: Dabigatran
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of dabigatran in 2013 for NVAF.

group.title: Rivaroxaban
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of rivaroxaban in 2013 for NVAF.

group.title: Vitamin K Antagonists
group.description: Patients with a first dispensing of VKA in 2013 for NVAF.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI's intellectual property rights.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: DOAC & VKA were prescribed by physicians in their daily practice,with differences for pts & disease characteristics,including stroke & bleeding risk factors.To control this pts were 1:1 matched on date of 1st dispensing, gender,age & hdPS.
